metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12448 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The bfd_cache_close function in bfd/cache.c in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29 and earlier, allows remote attackers to cause a heap use after free and possibly achieve code execution via a crafted nested archive file. This issue occurs because incorrect functions are called during an attempt to release memory. The issue can be addressed by better input validation in the bfd_generic_archive_p function in bfd/archive.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1

binutils-for-build - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1

libbinutils - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.29.1-1ubuntu1').
